title:
Black hole spin estimation of XTE J2012+381 using simultaneous
  observations of Swift/XRT and NuSTAR
abstract:
A sufficiently precise measurement of black hole spin is required to carry
out quantitative tests of the Kerr metric and to understand several phenomena
related to astrophysical black holes. After 24 years, XTE J2012+381 again
underwent an outburst in December 2022. In this work, we focused on the
measurement of spin and mass of black hole candidate XTE J2012+381 using
broadband spectral analysis of X-ray data from \emph{Swift/XRT} and
\emph{NuSTAR}. By using the relxillCp model, the spin and inclination of the
source were found to be $0.883_{-0.061}^{+0.033}$ and $46.2_{-2.0}^{+3.7}$
degrees, respectively for high disk density
($i.e.\;10^{20}\;\mathrm{cm}^{-3}$). We further test our results for lamp post
geometry using the relxilllpCp model. The spin and inclination of the source
were found to be $0.892_{-0.044}^{+0.020}$ and $43.1_{-1.2}^{+1.4}$ degrees,
respectively. Then "continuum-fitting" method was used for the soft state to
estimate the mass of BH and found to be
$7.95_{-3.25}^{+7.65}\;\mathrm{M}_{\odot}$ and
$7.48_{-2.75}^{+5.80}\;\mathrm{M}_{\odot}$ for the spin and inclination
estimated from the relxillCp and relxilllpCp model respectively. We used a
distance of 5.4 kpc as measured by Gaia using the parallax method. This study
also addresses the issue of supersolar iron abundance in XTE J2012+381 by using
\texttt{reflionx} based reflection model and found high disk density for the
source.
